Universal Search Architecture Plan:

1. SEARCH PROTOCOL (issue-5f8535):
   - Define standard search() method signature for all skills
   - Return format: {id, type, content, metadata, score}
   - Skills expose search via callable API (like notes.search_notes())
   
2. FRAMEWORK INTEGRATION (issue-ed1657):
   - Add 'agent search <query>' command to main CLI
   - Discover all skills with search capability
   - Call each skill's search() method in parallel
   - Aggregate and rank results across skills
   - Return unified JSON output for LLM consumption
   
3. SKILL IMPLEMENTATION (issue-7641eb):
   - notes: Already has search_notes() - standardize output
   - issues: Add search() for title, description, comments
   - planner: Add search() for task descriptions
   - cache: Add search() for cache keys/values
   - prompts: Add search() for prompt templates
   - vacuum: Add search() for knowledge entries
   - atlas: Add search() for code symbols/functions
   
Benefits:
- LLM can find relevant content across all skills
- Each result includes skill+ID for direct retrieval
- Extensible: new skills just implement search()
- No separate search skill needed

Implemented AI skill with LLM integration, embeddings, and semantic search. Supports OpenAI and Anthropic providers. Database schema created for tracking completions and embeddings.
Implemented automations skill with event-driven engine. Features: conditional triggers, action chains, execution history, enable/disable controls. Supports log and publish actions.

Implemented migrate skill for universal export/import. Features: JSON export/import, backup/restore, schema preservation, automatic backups, metadata tracking. Enables data portability and safe migrations.

Work session completed: Implemented 3 critical new skills - AI (LLM/embeddings/semantic search), Automations (event-driven engine), and Migrate (export/import system). All skills tested and working. Fixed atlas command installation issue.

Implemented database migration system with version tracking, checksums, automatic migration execution, CLI tools (create/run/status/history), and full documentation. System is backward compatible with legacy schema.sql files.

Issue analysis: Skills run in same process with full Python/system access via importlib. Current sandbox skill is just a placeholder. Need to implement proper isolation: 1) Process-level isolation for skills 2) Resource limits (CPU, memory, time) 3) Filesystem access controls 4) Network isolation options. Approaches: subprocess with restricted env, Docker containers, or Python's restrictedpython lib.

Implemented skill isolation: 1) Permission system with read/write/network/filesystem controls 2) RestrictedConnection wraps DB access with permission checks 3) RestrictedSkillContext enforces permissions on all skill operations 4) Default: read-only access, core skills get write permissions 5) Prevents skills from closing shared DB connection or accessing unauthorized resources

✅ Completed issue-5fd36a: Skill isolation. Implemented comprehensive permission system with read-only defaults. Skills now isolated via RestrictedSkillContext. All tests pass. Committed as 5eb520d. Ready for next priority issue.

Integration test plan: Test 12 skills (issues, migrate, automations, ai, atlas, prompts, planner, vacuum, temporal, feedback, cache, notes) following AGENTIC_WORKFLOW.md phases. Each test should verify: 1) Skill loads correctly 2) Context initialization 3) Database schema created 4) CLI commands work 5) Search API works 6) Event pub/sub 7) Permission enforcement 8) Error handling. Use pytest fixtures for common setup.

Created comprehensive integration test plan: 7 tasks, 12 skills to test, 5 workflow phases, dependency tree established. Task 1 (infrastructure) blocks all others. Cross-skill workflows depend on phase tests. Estimated 23 hours total. Documentation in docs/INTEGRATION_TEST_PLAN.md
